NoteLiteral.En:
Entry requirements: 
•	Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
•	B2 level of English language proficiency.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).
Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.
Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.

Description.En:
During Circular Economy for Sustainability micro-module, participants will gain an advanced knowledge and critical understanding of the concept and principles of circular economy and sustainability. This involves a paradigm shift in business, politics, science and society in general. Participants will be also trained to characterise and specify circular economy enablers and strategies. This includes understanding the fundamental conditions required for the circular transformation of organisations and ecosystems.

The module will guide participants in to circular economy ecosystems grouped into three distinct categories based on their system interactions and flows as well as their system-level goals, with five distinct types of ecosystems, namely: material flow-based industrial and urban ecosystems, knowledge flow-based entrepreneurial and knowledge ecosystems, and economic value flow-based innovation ecosystems.

NoteLiteral.En: Describe, analyse and apply principles of the circular economy in advancing business sustainability.

Title.En: Enablers and strategies for the circular transformation

PrefLabel.En: adopt ways to reduce negative impact of consumption

NoteLiteral.En: Characterize and specify enablers and strategies for the circular transformation of organizations and ecosystems.

Title.En: Complexity and multilevel of circular economy

NoteLiteral.En: Address complexity and multilevel of circular economy, using strategic documents.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
To participate in the assessment, students must complete all activities and engage with provided study resources each week. These resources typically include multiple video lectures lasting 15-20 minutes each.

The assessment consists of two parts: the Final test (20% of final grade) and practical Assignments 1 - 4 (60% of final grade; 4 tasks of 15% each).

Active participation in Discussion forums can earn 20% of the final grade.

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M108&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)

The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.

After the successful completion of the micro-module:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.

Micromodule Circular Economy for Sustainability is a part of the module of “Circular Economy Strategic Solutions”, which also includes such micro-modules as Circular Value Chains and Circular Business Models. The aim of the entire course is to provide the necessary knowledge and competencies to address the strategic level challenges of enabling the circular transformation of organisations and ecosystems. Acquired competences will be used to address challenges of the circular economy at the strategic level of organisations, based on new scientific knowledge, an interdisciplinary approach between different business functions, and systems thinking.

The aim of this micro-module is to provide students with the knowledge and competencies needed to fully contribute to the advancement of sustainability by developing a critical understanding of the circular transformation of organizations and ecosystems.
The knowledge and competencies gained in this micro-module will serve as a successful basis for the further micro-modules of this module, i.e. Circular Value Chains and Circular Business Models.

Entry requirements:

- Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
- Basics of sustainability,
- Basics of management.
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).

Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.  

Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.
